subject: Fashion
title: Microplastic Shedding from Synthetics
description: A short lesson to help you apply Microplastic Shedding from Synthetics.

hook.text: Every wash of a polyester shirt releases up to 700,000 tiny plastic fibers into the water.

buildup.text: Over 60% of all clothing today is made from synthetic fibers like polyester, nylon, and acrylic.

discovery.text: These microplastics slip through water treatment plants and flow straight into rivers and oceans.

twist.text: Marine animals eat them. They climb the food chain. Microplastics now appear in human blood.

climax.text: A single load of laundry can shed as much plastic as a grocery bagâ€”invisible but everywhere.

punchline.text: Your washing machine is a microplastic factory.

quiz.question: How many microplastic fibers can a single polyester garment release per wash?
